plantuml_diagram:
@startuml
!define AWSPuml https://raw.githubusercontent.com/awslabs/aws-icons-for-plantuml/v20.0/dist
!include AWSPuml/AWSCommon.puml

title MLflow Tracking Server - High Level Deployment Architecture

skinparam shadowing false
skinparam componentStyle rectangle

actor "ML Engineer / User" as user

cloud "Internet" as internet

node "Container Platform\n(Docker / Heroku Container Runtime)" as platform {
  node "MLflow Service Container" as app {
    artifact "Nginx\nReverse Proxy + Basic Auth\n(nginx + htpasswd)" as nginx
    artifact "Supervisor\n(process manager)" as supervisord
    artifact "MLflow Tracking Server\nPython + mlflow==2.4.1\nGunicorn + gevent\n(listens :5001 internal)" as mlflow

    supervisord --> nginx : manages
    supervisord --> mlflow : manages
    nginx --> mlflow : reverse proxy\nHTTP :80 -> :5001
  }
}

database "Relational DB\nBackend Store\n(PostgreSQL or MySQL)" as rdbms

cloud "Artifact Store" as artifacts {
  folder "Local filesystem\n./mlruns (default)" as localfs
  node "AWS S3 Bucket\n(s3://... via boto3)" as s3
}

node "CI/CD" as cicd {
  artifact "GitHub Actions\n(build/test/validate)" as gha
  artifact "Container Registry\nAmazon ECR Public" as ecr
  gha --> ecr : build & push images
}

user --> internet
internet --> nginx : HTTPS/HTTP\nBasic Auth

mlflow --> rdbms : SQLAlchemy backend store\n(Postgres via psycopg2\n/ MySQL via pymysql)
mlflow --> localfs : write artifacts\n(if local)
mlflow --> s3 : write artifacts\n(if configured)

platform ..> ecr : pull image

note right of rdbms
  Runtime selectable via env vars:
  - Postgres (docker-compose / Heroku Postgres)
  - MySQL (optional)
end note

note right of s3
  Optional artifact store:
  MLFLOW_ARTIFACT_URI=s3://...
  AWS credentials via env vars
end note

@enduml

architecture_description:
## High-level architecture

This codebase deploys an **MLflow Tracking Server** as a containerized service, fronted by **Nginx** for reverse proxying and **HTTP Basic Authentication**, with **Supervisor** managing both processes inside the container.

### Runtime / serving path
- **User (ML engineer / client)** accesses the service over the **Internet**.
- **Nginx (reverse proxy + basic auth)** is the public entrypoint (typically port 80/443). It enforces basic auth via `htpasswd` and forwards requests to MLflow.
- **MLflow Tracking Server** runs in Python (`mlflow==2.4.1`) using **Gunicorn with gevent workers**, listening on an internal port (5001) behind Nginx.
- **Supervisor (supervisord)** starts and monitors both Nginx and MLflow within the container.

### Persistence dependencies
- **Backend store (Relational DB)**: MLflow stores experiment/run metadata in a relational database.
  - Primary option in docker-compose: **PostgreSQL** (driver `psycopg2-binary`).
  - Optional alternative: **MySQL** (driver `pymysql`), selectable via environment variables.
- **Artifact store**: MLflow stores artifacts either:
  - On **local filesystem** (default `./mlruns` volume/path), or
  - In **AWS S3** (via `boto3`) when `MLFLOW_ARTIFACT_URI=s3://...` and AWS credentials are provided.

### Build & delivery
- **GitHub Actions** builds container images and pushes them to **Amazon ECR Public**.
- The **container platform** (Docker host or Heroku container runtime) pulls the image from ECR and runs it.

### Deployment variants reflected in the repo
- **Docker Compose**: includes a Postgres service and the MLflow container.
- **Heroku**: container deployment with **Heroku Postgres** addon as the backend store (artifact store can still be local/ephemeral or S3 depending on configuration).
